That's not compressed air it is a mixture of several compressed gases (usually dimethyl ether)

What is in the can? It's not just compressed air, is it? Are there any products that just have compressed air in them? Air is 78.08% nitrogen, 20.95% oxygen, 0.93% argon, 0.04% carbon dioxide. Nitrogen doesn't burn, oxygen isn't flammable, it's the oxidizer in flames, argon is inert, carbon dioxide doesn't burn, not much of anything else. I used an ancient can of so called compress air as a cleaner and the liquid I didn't realize was in the spray can ruined the thing I tried to clean.

When I want to use compressed air, I want only gaseous air in the same proportions as uncompressed just floating around air, like when compressed air comes out of a balloon.
